body.name: Trapped with the Duke of Ice: A Historical Regency Romance Novel
body.description: “It is not just the snow that keeps me by your side…”Duke Aiden does not want a Duchess but he needs a wife. Married only in name, it is too late when he realizes he got a lot more than he bargained for.Sacrificing for her siblings, Felicity reluctantly agrees to marry the brooding Duke of Ice. What she never expected was how guarded his heart really is…Snowbound together, Felicity’s fire slowly starts to melt Aiden’s walls. Yet when their budding affections reveal a dangerous secret everything changes. And now they are trapped in the castle with a murderer…*If you like powerful Dukes, loving Duchesses and a marvelous depiction of the majestic Regency and Victorian era, then Trapped with the Duke of Ice is the novel for you.An enchanting regency romance of 60,000 words (around 300 pages), written by Patricia Haverton and published by Cobalt Fairy.No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a sweet happily ever after.Pick up "Trapped with the Duke of Ice" today to discover Patricia's captivating story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can She Thaw His Heart
reviews.reviewText: Was he really Icy ? Or did circumstances make him that way ? Not wanting to feel Love he still needs a Wife to take care of his Brother! A Marriage of Convenience it is ! A Betrothal to a Lady that only wants to believe in Love. She has an obligation to her Family to marry him. With no hope of Love, partnership, or even friendship how can this marriage survive ? Patricia Haverton gives us this interesting tale of two people trying to exist along with a great mystery wrapped into it.Felicity Pike believed in love. She was outspoken and cared for her sister and would do anything for her family . Even Marry !Aiden Kingsman the Duke of Dawton was left to raise his Brother after his parents died. Leaving him cold and alone. With much guilt and responsibility.Felicity and Aiden meet when he sees her for the Betrothal. He immediately tells her they will live separate lives. With no hope of happiness she still marries him. What a Way To Start Out ! Little things begin to happen. There is someone in the house wanting to harm them . Danger is all around ! Can this bring them closer ?The Story has such depth to the characters that you easily connect. . You feel there emotions , pain , and struggles . So you only want that Happily Ever After ! Delightful, !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mystery, danger, found trust and therefore found love
reviews.reviewText: I first read "Three Rules to wed a Duke, then she gave 3 chapters of Trapped with the Icy Duke. Both books are about men who are stiff, and devoid o f emotion in the beginning. You will finally find out why they are that way and how their wives help them find happiness. I loved the first book and couldn't read it fast enough to find out the mystery therein. It was a blast. Had to immediately read the next book she offered and couldn't wait to find out its ending also. So much fun! Well written and captivating. I'm going to look for more books by Harriet!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hide and Seek
reviews.reviewText: Thank you Patricia. This was a very interesting story of learning to love and trying to find a murderer, a kidnapper and an arsonist. While searching a house full of secret rooms.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Felicity and Aiden
reviews.reviewText: Combining a duke who only wants a marriage of convenience and someone who can be a caretaker for his young brother, and a woman who only has interest to marry for love, but knows she has to save her family from financial ruin, equals a solid foundation. Add in engaging characters with flaws and internal struggles, side characters that become red herrings, and a solid mystery, and you have a perfect Patricia Haverton historical romance. Ms Haverton creates a compelling story filled with interesting characters, surprising drama and twist and turns. This story has Ms Haverton’s customary dramatic flair by including a mystery when strange things happen in the home. Shadows lurking, footsteps in the night, death threats and secrets, all woven throughout until the evil ones reach their goal. Or do they? I truly enjoyed this story! I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Very good plot and main characters you'll enjoy!
reviews.reviewText: I love this author and have many of her novels! However as a mystery--this one was not that great! I KNEW who it was right away.There were many times when moving from one action to anotherthe order of the movement seemed out of order!During the big fight between hero and Sabastion, the villain calledthe hero--"Brother" and I thought it was a good twist--that the manmight have been the hero's brother (bastard) BUT they ignored it!! Never asked him why he called the hero--Brother???The plot and the love story was beautiful but as to mystery--that needs work!I'm sorry to put anything negative and I'll continue to buy this author's books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Felicity finds herself in a marriage that Duke Aiden she has married doesn't want any kind of marriage. He wants someone to be a mother to his brother. Heartbroken that he doesn't not want something from this marriage but tries to make the best of it. She confronts the duke about being ignored and expects some respect. He agrees and makes an effort to at least have a good front. Felicity finds the brother Marcus a delight and they bond in a way as he is yearning for an attachment. As things seem to progress suddenly someone seems to put them in danger. They work together to figure who wants to harm them. ARC Review

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Has an extended epilogue.
reviews.reviewText: The book is great but it ends abruptly and the reader is directed to the extended epilogue. I don't appreciate the trick when I already paid for the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love has a way of finding us.
reviews.reviewText: Aiden married Felicity to help raise his brother. It was to be a marriage of convenience. She was determined they would at least be friends. When someone tried to harm her, and strange things started to happen he promised to keep her safe. Soon feelings developed between them. As they solved the mystery, they were finally able to admit their love for each other.
Strange that a titled single man only wants a convenient marriage for his brother, but as my title says - love takes time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: THREE PEOPLE WHO NEED EACH OTHER - WHEN WILL THEY REALISE -
reviews.reviewText: AIDEN - Had lived a solitary life in his mansion with a trusted solicitor Sebastian who worked for his father and knew the estate and he trusted him, there were the servants and also his eleven year old brother Marcus who he had very little interaction with. He hated his father the, old DUKE he was violent and cold to both Aiden an his mother he swore never to feel love again (although kind to his brother he spends very little time with him he convinced himself that he has no love for him he blames him for the death of his very much loved mother).Aiden has no wish to marry but realised Marcus needs a mother - he decides to marry for that reason only it will be a contract for a mother figure for his brother he himself will have little contact or interaction with either of them and he would make that very clear to whoever he marries.LADY FELICITY - Had a younger sister who she loves very much her parents have fallen on hard times she is kind and loving yet receives very little from her parents, who have arranged a marriage for her to the Duke she has never met, she knows of him and his title people call him The Duke Of Ice.I LOVED THIS STORY ALSO THE CHARACTERS YOU GOT TO KNOW THEM EVEN MARCUS THE YOUNG BOY BRILLIANT CHARACTERS - SO MANY SECRETS IN THIS HOME NOT JUST THE SECRET PASSAGES. YOU COULD FEEL THE LONELINESS OF FELICITY AND MARCUS AND EVEN AIDENIf there was a negative in this book it would be why oh why every time they sat down for a meal you were gun a description of the table THE Beautiful moist joint of beef the succulent carrots with butter etc etc this was at every meal time. ( Not necessary),LOVED ITI RECEIVED AN ARC

I liked this marriage of convenience story. The storyline is good and layered with romance and mystery. The characters are likable and well developed.Aiden is cold and aloof. He isn’t looking for love or friendship in a marriage but a maternal figure for his younger brother.Felicity agrees to marry the Duke of Ice in order to save her family from ruination.Aiden wants to keep his distance but is soon charmed by Felicity‘s kind and warm nature. But when their relationship becomes more affectionate, someone tries to kill them...I recommend this book to everyone who likes sweet and clean historical romances with mystery and suspense.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Trapped with the Duke of Ice
reviews.reviewText: This was a really good story, I am a fan of historical romance and this story did not disappoint me. Well written with good characters and good storyline. I would recommend this book and the author.

Marriages of convenience were nothing uncommon during regency times, but what if the spouses didn't devlelop feelings for each other, being doomed to spend the rest of your life with somebody who couldn't care less about you is a heartbreaking outlook for the future. Sometimes an evil threat you have to face together can be a game changer, but what a way to go...
